cheatsheet.title: Create a new Web Service from WSDL

intro.description:
This cheat sheet will guide you through the steps to create and optionally deploy a Web service starting with a WSDL describing the structure of a Web service.
This process begins by focusing on creating Web services defined by an existing WSDL file, followed by steps to import/create sources and specify/customize transformations between the Sources, XML Views and the Web service operations.
Note: These steps are sequential and require you to complete or skip each step before being allowed to Perform, Complete or Skip the next step.
To learn more about using cheat sheets click the help icon above.
Press "Click to Begin" button below to start.

item.title: Create a VDB
item.description:
First, you will need to create a VDB. This is where all the Web service information and models are stored on your local computer.
==========================================================================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below to create new VDB.
-- > You may skip this step if you have already imported this data.
==========================================================================================================

item.title: Create Web Service Model from WSDL
item.description:
This step will result in the creation of a new Web service model and an XML View model generated using an imported WSDL file and accompanying dependent XSD files.
==========================================================================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below to launch wizard.
-- > Repeat as as needed to obtain all desired source data.
-- > Press "Click to Complete" button below when finished.
-- > You may skip this step if you have already imported this data.
==========================================================================================================

item.title: Complete Web Service Operations
item.description:
The Create Web Service Model from WSDL step above generated a Web Service model that contains a template SQL transformation. As a template, it does not contain the actual business logic you want to deploy in a Web service.
Please review the transformations contained in your Web service operations and edit as required.
==========================================================================================================
-- > Press "Click to Complete" button below when finished.
-- > You may skip this step if you have already imported this data.
==========================================================================================================

item.title: Import from Relational Data Sources
item.description:
Next, you will need to obtain the structure of the database tables and procedures of interest. This will create a Source Model of your data
==========================================================================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below import source data.
-- > Repeat as as needed to obtain all desired source data.
-- > Press "Click to Complete" button below when finished.
-- > You may skip this step if you have already imported this data.
==========================================================================================================

item.title: Map XML View to Relational Sources
item.description:
An XML View model was created when you created your Web service model (above). Open each mapping class in your XML View Diagram and define its transformation. Double-click a mapping class in the diagram to edit the transformation. Consult the documentation for information on how to connect to relational data sources.
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
-- > Press "Click to Complete" button below when finished.
-- > You may skip this step if you have already imported this data.
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

item.title: Test XML Sources and Views
item.description:
Once your VDB is complete you can test it. A VDB is complete when all views have been mapped to sources, all sources have valid connector bindings, no validation errors exist and a "green" status is displayed in the Web Service Advisor.
==========================================================================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below to execute the VDB.
-- > Repeat as as needed to verify expected results.
-- > Press "Click to Complete" button below when finished.
-- > You may skip this step.
==========================================================================================================
Note - VDB and its models must be free of errors.
==========================================================================================================

item.title: Create Web Service WAR File
item.description:
You can now create a WAR file to deploy to a Servlet container with the Web services defined.
==========================================================================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below to create the WAR file
-- > In the dialog, specify WAR file location on your file system, set properties, view connector bindings information and finish by clicking "OK".
==========================================================================================================
Note - VDB and its models must be free of errors.
==========================================================================================================

item.title: Summary
item.description:
The Web service has been created and is ready to deploy. Here is a summary of the steps we have taken:
1. You created a VDB that holds all the models and configuration.
2. You used the Create Web Service wizard to generate a Web service model defined by an imported WSDL file as well as an associated XML View model used as the sources for the Web service operations.
3. You created a Relational Source Model via Import representing the structure of the database tables and procedures.
4. You mapped the XML View Model to relational source models.
5. You created a WAR file that contains all your work and is ready to deploy to a Servlet Container.
Select "Click to Complete" to go back to the beginning of this cheat sheet.
